document.docAuthor: Barbosa, D. N. & Azevedo, C. O.
document.docTitle: Laelius akares Barbosa & Azevedo 2009, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Laelius Ashmead (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae) from Madagascar, with description of two new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Laelius Ashmead (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae) from Madagascar, with description of two new species

subSubSection.paragraph: Description of female. Holotype ( Fig. 9 ). Body length 2.42 mm . LFW 1.39 mm .

Color. Palpi, trochanters, fore tibia and tarsi light castaneous; mandible, tegula, wing venation, mid femur, mid tibia and hind tibia castaneous; scape, pedicel, flagellum, coxae, fore femur, hind femur and metasoma dark castaneous; head and mesosoma dark castaneous nearly black; wings hyaline.

Head ( Fig. 10 ). Mandible with five sharpened apical teeth, two lower ones wider than others, with two thick dorsal setae. Clypeus with median lobe trapezoidal apical margin truncate, longer than wide, with sharpened median teeth at apical margin. First five antennal segments in ratio of about 22:10:6:8:8. WH 1.0x LH. WF 1.11x HE. WF 0.56x WH. OOL 1.36x WOT. VOL 0.63x HE. Distance of posterior ocellus to vertex crest 1.6x DAO. Frons coriaceous, punctures sparse. Frontal angle of ocellar triangle right, ocelli small, ocellar triangle broad, distance between inner margin of posterior ocelli about 3.0x DAO. Temple divergent anterad. Vertex slightly convex, corner rounded, lateral setae long and strong.

Wings ( Fig. 13 ). Tegula without setae. Subcostal vein in fore wing with eight dorsal setae; median vein with five; basal vein with two; anal vein with three and stigma with one dorsal setae. Radial vein straight, 0.81x as long as basal vein. Hind wing with three hamuli.
Metasoma. 2.04x longer than wide; tergum II as long as others; terga III–VI with transverse setae line on dorsal surface; metasoma with apex acute.
Description of male. Allotype ( Fig. 14 ). Body length 2.08 mm . LFW 1.31 mm .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 9–16.
Laelius akares
sp. nov.
9–13. Holotype. 9. Habitus; 10. Head in dorsal view; 11. Propodeum in dorsal view; 12. Mesopleuron in frontal view; 13. Fore wing in dorsal view. 14–16. Allotype. 14. Habitus; 15. Head in dorsal view; 16. Propodeum in dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Color. Pedicel, palpi, wing venation, trochanters, fore tibia, mid tibia and tarsi light castaneous; flagellum, tegula and hind tibia castaneous; scape, mandible, mid coxa, hind coxa and femora dark castaneous; head, mesosoma, fore coxa and metasoma dark castaneous nearly black; wings hyaline.

Head ( Fig. 15 ). Mandible with five sharpened apical teeth, two lower wider than others, with one thick dorsal setae. Clypeus with median lobe trapezoidal apical margin truncate, longer than wide, with sharpened median teeth at apical margin. First five antennal segments in ratio of about 21:14:11:15:15. WH 0.91x LH. WF 1.45x HE. WF 0.78x WH. OOL 0.94x WOT. VOL 0.68x HE. Distance of posterior ocellus to vertex crest 1.0x DAO. Frons coriaceous, punctures sparse. Frontal angle of ocellar triangle obtuse, ocellus large, ocellar triangle compact, distance between inner margin of posterior ocelli about 3.0x DAO. Temple divergent anterad. Vertex slightly convex, corner rounded, lateral setae long and strong.

Wings ( Fig. 20 ). Tegula without setae. Subcostal vein in fore wing with ten dorsal setae; median vein with five; basal vein with two; anal vein with three and stigma with two dorsal setae. Radial vein slightly curved forward, 1.5x as long as basal vein. Hind wing with three hamuli.
Metasoma. 1.87x longer than wide; tergum II longer than others; terga III–VI with transverse setae line on dorsal surface; metasoma with apex acute.
Genitalia ( Fig. 21-A ). Aedeagus dorsal profile bottle-shaped; constriction between basal and apical region present; apical lobe separate.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 17–21.
Laelius akares
sp. nov.
Allotype. 17. Propodeum in dorsal view; Paratype; 18–19. Mesopleuron in frontal view. 20. Fore wing in dorsal view; 21. Genitalia in ventral view. (allotype Figs. 17–18, 20, 21.A; paratype Figs. 19, 21.B–D).

FIGURES 22–23.
Laelius mekes
sp. nov.
Holotype. 22. Propodeum in dorsal view; 23. Mesopleuron in frontal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. Madagascar .

Etymology. The specific epithet
akares ,
from Greek, refers to the short length of radial vein in the fore wing.

Variation. Female: body length 2.39–2.42 mm ; LFW 1.38–1.40 mm ; clypeus with apical margin slightly angulate, apical vertex slightly rounded, and median carina slightly broader than others in dorsal view; length of notaulus much shorter than holotype ; mesopleuron with ridge weakly marked between lower and posterior fovea, pit of mesopleural fovea slightly smaller than holotype . Male: body length 2.07–2.10 mm ; LFW 1.29–1.31 mm ; clypeus with trapezoidal and subtrapezoidal shapes, apical margin slightly angulate, apical vertex slightly rounded; length of notaulus much shorter than holotype ; propodeal disc with median carina incomplete, or without longitudinal ridge between median carina and inner discal carina, or without longitudinal ridge between inner discal carina and second pair of discal carina ( Fig. 17 ); mesopleuron with anterior fovea opened; episternal furrow with inner margin not striate ( Fig. 19 ); fore wing with median vein with four setae, radial vein 1.50–1.53x as long as basal vein; genitalia with aedeagus slightly constricted between basal and apical region, apical lobe narrow, touching each other and with apex rounded ( Fig. 21-B ), apical lobe touching each other with inner side of apex straight ( Fig. 21-C ), apex of apical lobe rounded, slightly constriction on basal region ( Fig. 21-D ).

Remarks. After we compared this species with all other species of
Laelius ,
we concluded that this species is similar to
L. yokohamensis Terayama
Japan and
L. femoralis Forster
from Germany by having the eyes large, the propodeal disc with five carinae, the median and inner discal carina complete, the presence of longitudinal ridge between median and inner discal carinae and the presence of longitudinal ridge between inner and second pair of discal carinae. These are the only species that have these characters. However,
L. akares
has the ocellar triangle with right frontal angle, the sublateral carinae absent and the posterior margin of stigma truncate, whereas
L. yokohamensis
and
L. femoralis
have the ocellar triangle with obtuse frontal angle, the sublateral carinae present and the posterior margin of stigma convex.

This species is also similar to the widespread
L. pedatus Say
by having the posterior margin of stigma truncate. However,
L. akares
has the eyes large and the longitudinal ridges on propodeal disc, whereas
L. pedatus
has the eyes small and the longitudinal ridges on propodeal disc are absent.
